subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology
subSections.text: Probably from stem ''shiwa'' of verb ''shiwaru'' ({{l|ja|撓る}}: “to sag, as something elastic that has lost its bounce”). Probably cognate with {{m|ja|皺|tr=shibo}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|しわ}}

# [[wrinkle]]s in [[skin]], [[paper]], [[cloth]], or some other surface
# [[ripple]]s on the [[surface]] of [[water]]
# a [[pattern]] of [[crack]]s and [[wrinkle]]s on the [[surface]] of an {{m|ja|烏帽子|tr=eboshi||traditional Japanese formal black hat}} formed as the black [[lacquer]] dries
